Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix bitmap leak in GridEntry" (#9040)

Issues.Title: Compute Anchors for Nested containers.
Issues.Body:
- Controls anchored within the nested containers are never getting chance to compute `AnchorInfo `in V2 layout and thus seeing issues mentioned in #8933. 
- Explicit bounds change on the control either by setting Properties like `Size`, `Location` or by calling public APIs `SetBounds` should recompute `AnchorsInfo` for the control. We documented this but missed in the validation. Issue #8494.
- Added unit tests covering these scenarios.

Fixes #8933 
Fixes #8494 

Anchor UI needs VS servicing to pick these changes.

replacing #9006. 

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9006)

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9038)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Compute Anchors for Nested containers." (#9038)

Issues.Title: Fix GDI handle leak in GridEntry.
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9028

This is a regression in .NET 7.0. Resizing a `PropertyGrid` control will continue to leak GDI handles until they are exhausted, eventually crashing the application.

There is no workaround as this is a native handle leak.

Validated repro manually.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9041)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix GDI handle leak in GridEntry." (#9041)

Issues.Title: WinformsControlTest does not work for outside contributors
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-preview.3.23178.7

### Issue description

The app shows a prompt to install Preview 4, but Preview 4 is not available to community contributors.

This link is given:
https://aka.ms/dotnet-core-applaunch?framework=Microsoft.NETCore.App&&framework_version=8.0.0-preview.4.23221.1&&arch=x64&&rid=win10-x64&&gui=true

As you can see, when this link is used, it redirects to downloading Preview 3 instead of 4:
https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/thank-you/runtime-desktop-8.0.0-preview.3-windows-x64-installer?cid=getdotnetcore

(Also, the "Show details/hide details" window is extremely broken on 200% DPI screens. If you click it multiple times, it blocks everything on the screen.)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8040367/233797337-a63eb333-4d55-4827-9ecb-1ad30712d099.png)


### Steps to reproduce

Clone repo, run `Restore.cmd`, install .NET SDK 8.0.100-preview.3.23178.7, select the WinformsControlTest project as the startup project, press F5.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WinformsControlTest does not work for outside contributors" (#9025)

Issues.Title: Use native IAccessible handles directly
Issues.Body:
When using system IAccessible handles directly we get increased performance and easier to debug code. This also puts us a step closer to trimmability.

This removes the `SystemIAccessbileWrapper` class and instead puts shared `IAccessible` access code in `AccessibleObjectExtensions`.

Also:

- Moves a bit more towards CsWin32
- Change AgileComPointer to allow not tracking disposal
- Only derive AgileComPointer from tracker in debug builds
- Only build tracker in debug builds (don't want it slipping in and taking stack traces)
- Add new API to extract from ComWrappers to ComHelpers


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9015)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Use native IAccessible handles directly" (#9015)

Issues.Title: Unckeck one listview item is unchecking all checked items
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/Unckeck-one-listview-item-is-unchecking-/10347342)._

---
[severity:It's more difficult to complete my work]
In a Windows form I have a tabcontrol. In code, I create a tabpage with a listview and I add a handler for the listview ItemCheck event. 
The listview multiselect property is set to TRUE. 
The handler select/deselect the listview item conforms the user check/uncheck it.
It works fine for check listview items, but when you uncheck just one item, all the others checked items are unchecked too.

This is the code:
```
Imports Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging
Imports System.Globalization
Imports System.Security.Policy
Public Class Form1

    Private Sub Form1_Load(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load
        Dim txt As String = "02/2023"
        Dim lv As ListView
        Dim pg As TabPage

        Me.TabControl1.TabPages.Clear()
        pg = NewTabPage(Me.TabControl1, txt)
        lv = pg.Controls(0)
        Me.TabControl1.SelectTab(0)
    End Sub

    Private Function NewTabPage(ByRef TabCtrl As TabControl, ByVal txt As String) As TabPage

        For Each tp As TabPage In TabCtrl.TabPages
            If tp.Text = txt Then
                tp.Select()
                NewTabPage = tp
                Exit Function
            End If
        Next

        Dim lv As New ListView
        Dim pg As New TabPage With {.Text = txt}
        TabCtrl.TabPages.Add(pg)

        With lv
            .Parent = pg
            .Name = txt
            .View = View.Details
            .Dock = DockStyle.Fill
            .LabelEdit = False
            .AllowColumnReorder = True
            .CheckBoxes = True
            .FullRowSelect = True
            .GridLines = True
            .HeaderStyle = ColumnHeaderStyle.Clickable
            .MultiSelect = True
            .Columns.Add("MONTH", 100, HorizontalAlignment.Center)
            .Columns.Add("BRANCH", 60, HorizontalAlignment.Center)
            .Columns.Add("ACCT", 60, HorizontalAlignment.Left)
            .Columns.Add("SSN", 100, HorizontalAlignment.Center)
            .Columns.Add("CUSTOMER", 140, HorizontalAlignment.Left)
            pg.Controls.Add(lv)
            AddHandler .ItemCheck, AddressOf Me.lv_ItemCheck
        End With

        For i As Integer = 1 To 10
            Dim lvi As New ListViewItem(txt & Format(i, "-00"))
            With lvi
                .SubItems.Add("0001")
                .SubItems.Add("BB" & Format(100 * i, "-0000"))
                .SubItems.Add("001.01234-12" & Format(i, "-00"))
                .SubItems.Add("STAR DRUGSTORE " & Format(i, "00"))
                lv.Items.Add(lvi)
            End With
        Next
        pg.Select()
        pg.Focus()
        NewTabPage = pg

    End Function

    Public Sub lv_ItemCheck(sender As Object, e As ItemCheckEventArgs)
        Dim lv As ListView = sender
        Dim ix As Integer = e.Index

        If e.CurrentValue = CheckState.Checked Then
            lv.Items(ix).Selected = False
        Else
            lv.Items(ix).Selected = True
        End If
    End Sub

End Class

```
- Windows 10 Pro Version 10.0.19044, PT-BR
- MS Visual Studio Professional 2022(64 bits) - Current Version 17.5.4
- Directs to .NET 6.0.
- MS .NET Framework version 4.8.04084

---
### Original Comments

#### Feedback Bot on 4/25/2023, 10:21 AM: 

(private comment, text removed)

---
### Original Solutions
(no solutions)

<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #8203

NOTE: this fix will address update to string interpolation after System.Drawing.* is moved to Winforms.

## Proposed changes

- change/update string.Format to use string interpolation instead
- 
- 

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- It should be none
- 

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal, as it only replace string.Format to use string interpolation instead

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- No tests are added, as it is focusing on updating code to use string interpolation.
- 
- 

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->

Issues.Title: Form is removed from Application.OpenForms after RecreateHandle
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net6, .Net7 checked.

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

I checked only .Net6, .Net7 but according to the code, problem exist in all versions (.net framework too).

### Issue description

While working on https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/3606  I found that after calling to `RecreateHandle`, the form is completely removed from `Application.OpenForms`.

The form is added to `Application.OpenForms` in two cases:
1. `OnLoad`.
2. `SetVisibleCore(true)`  ðŸ¤”

The form is removed from `Application.OpenForms` in two cases:
1. `OnFormClosed`.
2. `OnHandleDestroyed` ðŸ¤”ðŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸

Here we clearly see that after `RecreateHandle` we will completely lost our form from `Application.OpenForms` :( We call `RecreateHandle` for the form in several cases (`ShowInTaskbar` \ `RightToLeft` change etc...).
I still can't say for sure how much duplication of the `Application.OpenForms.Remove` call in `OnHandleDestroyed` is necessary.

### Steps to reproduce

[FormCloseTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11304011/FormCloseTest.zip)

0. Build.
1. Run.
2. Press button2 => `Application.OpenForms` will contains 3 forms (main, mdiParent and mdiChild).
3. Press button3 => `Application.OpenForms` will contains 1 form - main.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form is removed from Application.OpenForms after RecreateHandle" (#9029)

Fixes part of [9005](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/9005)


## Proposed changes
Add ToolStripMenuItems and ToolStripButtons to cover different checked combinations.

Easier to test CheckState values of ToolStripMenuItems and ToolStripButtons from winforms repo

Issues.Title: Exception pops up when executing Metafile.GetMetafileHeader(String fileName)
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-preview.4.23220.10 + the  latest binaries built for Winforms main branch

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it doesn't reproduced in .Net 7.0

### Issue description

An automation case: XMetafile, it failed for some scenarios when test Metafile.GetMetafileHeader, it may be caused by PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8995

**Failed log:**
              _System.ArgumentException: Parameter is not valid.
   at System.Drawing.SafeNativeMethods.Gdip.CheckStatus(Int32 status) in C:\Users\xxx\Documents\Winforms\src\System.Drawing.Common\src\System\Drawing\Gdiplus.cs:line 83
   at System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile.GetMetafileHeader(String fileName) in C:\Users\xxx\Documents\Winforms\src\System.Drawing.Common\src\System\Drawing\Imaging\Metafile.cs:line 575
   at XMetafile.GetMetafileHeader(TParams p, String fileName) in C:\Users\xxx\Desktop\XMetafile_p1\XMetafile_p1\XMetafile.cs:line 148
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Void** arguments, Signature sig, Boolean isConstructor)
   at System.Reflection.MethodInvoker.Invoke(Object obj, IntPtr* args, BindingFlags invokeAttr)_
           


### Steps to reproduce

**Sample app:**
[WinFormsApp17.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11291683/WinFormsApp17.zip)

**Tested metafiles**:
[work.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11291714/work.zip)

**Repro steps:**
1. Build and run above provided app, 
2. Stop runtime when form is running

**Actual result**: application is in break mode
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/233524101-5b7a8180-4d9f-4ab3-927a-290529e63ce7.png)

**Expected result**: App works well when targeting .Net 7.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Exception pops up when executing Metafile.GetMetafileHeader(String fileName)" (#9019)

Issues.Title: Fix null reference in PermonV2 mode.
Issues.Body:
Null check should be explicit to avoid further access of the Item object. It is not uncovered until we enabled PermonV2 mode for the designer.

Fixes #[5125](https://github.com/microsoft/winforms-designer/issues/5125)
Fixes #[5124](https://github.com/microsoft/winforms-designer/issues/5124)

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9018)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix null reference in PermonV2 mode." (#9018)

Issues.Title: WinForms Designer appears to be completely broken in .NET 7 (ToolStripContainer issue?)
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Visual Studio Version 17.5.4

### .NET version

7.0

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Yes

### Issue description

I haven't worked with WinForms for a little while and created a *brand new* project.

1. Once the project was created, it was automatically loaded into the IDE. I got a message saying it was trying to load the form but after several minutes, it never loaded. I was finally able to load the form by restarting Visual Studio and reloading the project.
2. I created a menu, and double clicked one of the menu commands. This took me to the editor and positioned the cursor in the Form1_Load method. No handler was created for the menu command. I tried this about a dozen times. Then I went to the Properties window to the Click even dropdown. It showed an expected name for the handler. But when I double click on this, it again takes me to the Form_Load handler, and no handler was created for the menu command.
3. So I tried deleting the Form_Load handler. As expected, this gave me an error, which I corrected in the designer source. Then I got about a half dozen error messages in the IDE. I saved everything and rebuilt.
4. Now I was able to run the app without errors again. But all my menus and previous work was gone!

### Steps to reproduce

The steps were outlined above. I would think anyone who spent 15 minutes creating a new WinForms app and adding some event handlers will surely see there are problems here.

### Diagnostics

I tried to go through the steps in your troubleshooting guide, but for me, the Show output from dropdown only has one option: Package Manager. This is way beyond sending you an error report. It seems that virtually nothing is working for me here.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WinForms Designer appears to be completely broken in .NET 7 (ToolStripContainer issue?)" (#9016)

Issues.Title: Add checked ToolStripMenuItems to WinformsControlsTest app
Issues.Body:
Part of #9005


## Proposed changes

- Add menu items to cover different checked combinations, replacing previous single checked item

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Easier to test CheckState values of ToolStripMenuItem from winforms repo

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- None

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102954094/233435055-144c7fe2-7bbf-4ac4-bd5f-4b920fcbe101.png)
A single checked item, that cannot be unchecked

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102954094/233434492-30a989a9-70ea-4e79-9d8d-6f1b86ec60dc.png)
Multiple items covering all checked options

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->

As expected, Narrator announces checked state where needed:

> Unchecked CheckOnClick(F), menu item, <say-as interpret-as="spell">1</say-as> of <say-as interpret-as="spell">6</say-as>, 
> Unchecked CheckOnClick(T), menu item, unchecked, <say-as interpret-as="spell">2</say-as> of <say-as interpret-as="spell">6</say-as>, Ctrl+ C, 
> Checked CheckOnClick(F), menu item, checked, <say-as interpret-as="spell">3</say-as> of <say-as interpret-as="spell">6</say-as>, 
> Checked CheckOnClick(T), menu item, checked, <say-as interpret-as="spell">4</say-as> of <say-as interpret-as="spell">6</say-as>,

Issues.Title: Fix error dialog on editing AutoCompleteCustomSource in PropertyGrid
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9008

Regression was introduced in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/8142 (from .NET 8). Replacing cast to be similar to other `CopyTo` overrides, for example:
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/024a9ab98d4bea535ce9fe6c473326bcd00464b7/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/DataGridViewCellCollection.cs#L48
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/024a9ab98d4bea535ce9fe6c473326bcd00464b7/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/TableLayoutStyleCollection.cs#L130

## Proposed changes

- Replace invalid cast to string[] with cast to ICollection

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- AutoCompleteCustomSource property can be edited

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/233242927-0d02986d-4873-4f39-ba96-69a295c20c40.png)

### After

![autocomplete-fix](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102954094/233406119-c2cb8bcb-33f1-4137-9603-4184d440fad8.gif)


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .NET 8.0.100-preview.4.23218.21
